phylo3D.tools
Class ToolWithWalrusOutput

java.lang.Object
  phylo3D.tools.Tool
      phylo3D.tools.ToolWithWalrusOutput
Direct Known Subclasses:
NCBItoWalrus, NHtoWalrus
public abstract class ToolWithWalrusOutput
extends Tool

Abstract class implementing functionality required by tools producing Walrus trees. This functionality consists of methods for computing the legend and the tree colouring, and for printing the results to file.

Author:
Tim Hughes (Computational Biology Unit - University of Bergen - Norway)

                                                     throws FatalException
Takes an option block with node/colour pairs and produces a Vector of objectsColourAssociations

Parameters:
optionBlock - String which is the option block to be parsed for the node/colour pairs
Returns:
Vector of objectsColourAssociations
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Thrown if node/colour pairs are improperly defined
FatalException

produceOutputFiles

protected void produceOutputFiles(java.lang.String filePath,
                                  TreeWalrus treeWalrus,
                                  java.util.Vector objectsColourAssociations,
                                  boolean colourSubtreeRootBranch,
                                  java.util.Vector taxonomyColouredWalrusNodes,
                                  java.util.Vector taxonomyObjectsColourAssociations,
                                  boolean sortLegendAlphabetically)
                           throws FatalException
Computes and prints to file the taxonomy legend, the legend, and the coloured Walrus tree

Parameters:
filePath - Path to the file that will contain the (coloured) Walrus tree
treeWalrus - TreeWalrus not yet coloured
objectsColourAssociations - Vector of ObjectsColourAssociations needed for producing the legend and the colouring of the TreeWalrus
colourSubtreeRootBranch - boolean determines whether the branch leading to the node at the root of the subtree should be coloured
taxonomyColouredWalrusNodes - Vector of ObjectsColourAssociations where the objects are NodeDataWalrus nodes
taxonomyObjectsColourAssociations - Vector of ObjectsColourAssociations where the first object is the matching column, the second object is the colouring column and the third object is the full lineage string
sortLegendAlphabetically - boolean indicating whether to sort the taxonomy legends alphabetically
Throws:
FatalException

determineLegendFile

private java.io.File determineLegendFile(java.lang.String outputFilePath,
                                         boolean isTaxonomyLegend)
Determines the file to write the legend to. Creates a file in the same directory as the file where the Walrus tree is placed with the same name but the extension ".jpg"

Parameters:
outputFilePath - String containing path to file which Walrus tree is to be written to
Returns:
File to which the Legend will be written

computeInputsToLegend

private void computeInputsToLegend(java.util.Vector texts,
                                   java.util.Vector colours,
                                   java.util.Vector objectsColourAssociations)
Computes the inputs need to produce the legend namely the texts and the corresponding colours. The texts and colours variables are modifi

Parameters:
texts - String array of texts
colours - String array of colours
objectsColourAssociations - Vector of ObjectsColourAssociations where the objects are NodeDataWalrus

computeInputsToTaxonomyLegend

private void computeInputsToTaxonomyLegend(java.util.Vector texts,
                                           java.util.Vector colours,
                                           java.util.Vector taxonomyObjectsColourAssociations,
                                           boolean sortAlphabetically)
Computes the text and colour inputs to the Taxonomy legend by extracting from the taxonomyObjectsColourAssociations a colour for each colouring string. TaxonomyObjectsColourAssociations will usually contain multiple entries with the same colouring string.

Parameters:
texts - String array to be updated by this function with the colouring strings
colours - Color array of the colours associated with each colouring string
taxonomyObjectsColourAssociations - Vector of ObjectsColourAssociations where first object is matching string, second object is colouring string and third object is full lineage string
sortAlphabetically - boolean indicating whether the legend labels should be ordered alphabetically

textToUseInLegend

protected abstract java.lang.String textToUseInLegend(NodeData nd)
Method that should be overridden by the subclass so that the data from the NodeData is used as the text in the legend

Parameters:
nd - NodeData which is extracted from the nodes of the TreeWalrus
Returns:
String containing the desired data

produceWalrusTree

public static void produceWalrusTree(TreeWalrus treeWalrus,
                                     java.util.Vector objectsColourAssociations,
                                     java.lang.String filePath,
                                     boolean colourSubtreeRootBranch,
                                     java.util.Vector taxonomyColouredWalrusNodes)
                              throws FatalException
Produces the Walrus tree by first colouring it (with both taxonomy and specific nodes) and then printing it to file

Parameters:
treeWalrus - TreeWalrus to be coloured and printed to file
objectsColourAssociations - Vector of ObjectsColourAssociations specifying how to colour the treeWalrus
filePath - String specifying the path of the file to which the coloured treeWalrus is to be written
colourSubtreeRootBranch - determines whether the branch leading to the subtree root node should be coloured.
taxonomyColouredWalrusNodes - Vector of ObjectsColourAssociations where the Objects NodeDataWalrus nodes from the TreeWalrus
Throws:
FatalException

colourWalrusTree

private static void colourWalrusTree(TreeWalrus treeWalrus,
                                     java.util.Vector objectsColourAssociations,
                                     boolean colourSubtreeRootBranch)
Colours the Walrus tree

Parameters:
treeWalrus - TreeWalrus to be coloured
objectsColourAssociations - Vector of ObjectsColourAssociations containing the colouring information. Note that the objects must be NodeDataWalrus objects that are to be coloured and that this method takes into account the possibility that there may be several NodeDataWalrus objects that are to be coloured in the same way.
colourSubtreeRootBranch - determines whether the branch leading to the subtree root node should be coloured.
